summary: The Fourteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, adopted in 1868, gives former slaves citizenship and equal rights. It's one of the most important changes to the Constitution, helping to end racism and discrimination. This amendment made sure everyone, no matter their race or origin, has the same protection under the law. It was a big step towards making America fairer, and it's been used in many important court cases over the years to fight against unfair treatment.
title: Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution
